Here goes.
A/V : nothing to say.

Now the movie...
I didn't really know what to expect when DLing this, but it was a good surprise. The ambiance is really nice, the soundscore is really good, and no : it's not independance day, or any kind of high budget shit (good or bad). It's a modest budget movie that managed to do really well. I don't think it's a spoiler to say there is not much interaction with the aliens, just enough to keep the movie interesting.
To wrap it up, if you're looking into holliwood badass budget alien whipping, not for you.
If you're into more "independant cinema" and a nice simple story directed well, that's for you.

This seems to be HD at best, rather than BR, so it's not the best quality I've seen. A bit better than a DVDrip perhaps. Not bad in any case.

And, since everybody is treating this like imdb, I'll say that I found the film good overall. I don't get comments like "It's amazing how low the level has reached" ?? The level of what? This is not starship troopers nor any of those films for teenagers (no offense) or "adults" with IQs of 1 digit.

Does anyone else realise there is a clip missing at the end or is it just me? Wikipedia states a different ending to the one I have just watched.

Anyone else?

@Sharak23

With you there mate - Alien was the first movie I watched that gave me nightmares for years. I can remember my Dad coming back from watching it at the cinema - I must've been about five.
